decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Notwithstanding details in these respects shown on the submitted drawings, the approved patio door-head shall be constructed as a cambered brick arch (and not a flat or 'soldier' arch as shown); and , bricks used to infill the existing window and door openings, and to replace the brick arches above them, shall be laid in Flemish bond.  REASON:  To preserve the special character of the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area.  (Cambered brick arches are the original form of window-head brick detailing for this house.  Flemish bonding has been used throughout the original building). | Samples of bricks to be used to fill in the existing openings, and in the cambered arch, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before commencement of the approved development.  Such details as are approved shall be implemented.  REASON:  To preserve the special character of the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area.
description: Replacement of existing ground floor openings (door and 2x windows) in rear face of rear projection of house with 'french' doors (Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area)
